title: Bit_Happy
author: Bit_Happy
created_time: December 03, 2023, 01:16:07 PMLast edit: December 13, 2023, 02:16:04 AM by Bit_Happy
content: "Christmas Vacation" For all our Staff and Students!1) All development and publicity efforts are being 100% shut down for at least 36 to 48 hours, and probably several days/weeks after.2) No payments (zero) have been accepted for any of my current efforts. At this point that is a good thing. No refunds to do, or other related issues. Why?* I have two close family members facing surgery soon, and will be moving "Home for the Holidays" right after packing and making travel plans. * When I make it back here, some of you really will not want to miss out. Please don't "let yourself down" by forgetting the future is created by people who jump ahead of the crowds. The future can still be bright! Sponsored by +++ Positive Coin +++Happy Holidays :: (This is an interesting, non-promo thread) Do You Know The First Times Bitcoin Ever Had Real World Value? ps. Remember, every one of you has great potential to succeed - and/or what do you lose by trying... ...lol?* There is a talented dynamic group here, and many of them are interested in a co-op effort to become certified Blockchain & Smart Contract Experts.* That alone, has great future value.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: QuoteThe "$500 to $1,000 for One Week" starts as a combination of some "Real Money" and mostly credits* for our valuable projectsWhat is the percentage of that word "mostly"? Will it be 50% of your valuable credits or higher?Interested.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: So basically you're looking for a community tester and manager, who may need to do some campaign/ads management? I'm interested too. I've worked with some bounty management projects in the past as an assistant, and do some management and content creation jobs for Coinbench. I'd prefer if you give a more private option to negotiate the deal instead of asking publicly like this. Would it be fine if I drop you a pm?

comments.author: Liquid_Gas
comments.body: I don't participate in the forum much, because so many of the projects are low quality, and your offer looks really interesting.1) n/a2) For part-time easy, I will do $150 a week any time.3) Yes

comments.author: rohang
comments.body: 1) NA2) 200$3) YesAdditional note: I am a professional software tester for websites,applications previously worked for a FAANG coorporation and currently working for a similar stature company (proof can be provided in PM). i believe i would be able to help more than a usual member for the testing part especially.Thanks for consideration

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Bit_Happy on December 03, 2023, 01:16:07 PMThe "$500 to $1,000 for One Week" starts as a combination of some "Real Money" and mostly credits* for our valuable projects (*When you see our video some of you will be amazed! Those credits can turn into exciting amounts of Real Money, in the near future)~snip~In other words, everyone who is chosen for this job will mostly get some worthless tokens/shitcoins that they may be able to exchange for something the OP calls "Real Money" one day in the future. Given that Bitcoin is not mentioned as a payment method at all, this has a place in Altcoins Services.
